The disparity between men and women who have children is well known. In a widely cited paper from 2019, Henrik Kleven of Princeton University, with co-authors, **charted the careers** of Danish parents after their first child was born. Mothersâ€™ pay and working hours plunged, by a third and a fifth, respectively, in the first year after childbirth. Fathersâ€™ careers continued roughly as before.
